page.title: 11PRESS LETTERS HUNTINGDON.
page.content: The majority of the letters were either complaints or thankyous. A disabled man was left waiting 2 hours for a taxi in the high street. When asked why he wasn't collected the taxi firm said " We are not allowed to pick people up in the high street". Controversy has arisen over the councils decision to ask the parents of pupils at Hinchingbrooke school to clean windows.Others, whilst agreeing in theory to the plan think that the issue was mishandled by the council. Thanks has been expressed to the staff at Hinchingbrooke hospital for their efficiency.Complaints have been received about the queues in car parks.An alternative suggestion was that payment be made on exit with an automatic barrier installed for entry.
